meanings.definition: Deserving to be trusted to pay back money that is borrowed
meanings.sent1: She proved to be creditworthier when she paid back the loan on time.
meanings.sent2: The bank considered him creditworthier due to his stable job and good credit score.
meanings.sent3: It's always a relief to find a creditworthier friend who never forgets to pay you back.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty and reliability make her the creditworthier choice for a business partner.
meanings.sent5: Being creditworthier is like having a golden ticket to financial opportunities.

meanings.definition: More likely to be able to borrow money and pay it back
meanings.sent1: The new regulations aim to make borrowers more creditworthier.
meanings.sent2: As his income increased, he became creditworthier in the eyes of lenders.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed creditworthier than the dog when it came to getting a loan.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, being creditworthier opens many doors for investment.
meanings.sent5: His dedication to saving money made him the creditworthier choice for the loan.
